oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Interference effect on heavy Higgs resonance signal in \gamma\gamma and ZZ channels
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jung, Sunghoon
Song, Jeonghyeon
Yoon, Yeo Woong
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: High Energy Physics - Phenomenology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The resonance-continuum interference is usually neglected when the width of a resonance is small compared to the resonance mass. We re-examine this standard by studying the interference effects in high-resolution decay channels, $\gamma\gamma$ and $ZZ$, of the heavy Higgs boson $H^0$ in nearly aligned two-Higgs-doublet models. For the $H^0$ with a sub-percent width-to-mass ratio, we find that, in the parameter space where the LHC 14 TeV $ZZ$ resonance search can be sensitive, the interference effects can modify the $ZZ$ signal rate by ${\cal O}(10)\%$ and the exclusion reach by ${\cal O}(10)$ GeV. In other parameter space where the $ZZ$ or $\gamma\gamma$ signal rate is smaller, the LHC 14 TeV reach is absent, but a resonance shape can be much more dramatically changed. In particular, the $\gamma\gamma$ signal rate can change by ${\cal O}(100)\%$. Relevant to such parameter space, we suggest variables that can characterize a general resonance shape. We also illustrate the relevance of the width on the interference by adding non-standard decay modes of the heavy Higgs boson.
Comment: 22 pages, 10 figures; added discussion about real-part interference
